EmailTemplate.name: RE: New MBO Point of Contact (1349906434.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: New MBO Point of Contact (1349906434.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Alan, You could absolutely ask them to me a direct contract with MBO if they want to work with you. I would send them something like this. Dear Client, I would like to introduce you to Sara Conde, she is my contact at MBO Partners. MBO runs my back office and billing and Sara will be in touch with you to discuss paperwork and next steps. If you would like to learn a little more about MBO Partners please click here <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Partners_Introduction.pdf>. Thank you, Alan It is ok with MBO if you have already started working, we can just back bill for that date. Is there a good number for me to reach you on? I would love to catch up with you via phone. Thanks!Sara___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com If you are in the DC area please check out our upcoming networking event! Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. -----Original Message----- From: Alan Fairbank [mailto:fairbanka@gmail.com] Sent: Wednesday, October 10, 2012 3:06 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: New MBO Point of Contact Dear Sara: I have been consulting with the Bank sine 1980, and they have always paid me directly as an independent consultant. The problem I have recently discovered is that, in doing so, they force be to become a WB staff member, subject to all the restrictions (post-employment) that are applied to staff members separating from the Bank (one-year cooling off period, two-year ban on contracting with anyone that would benefit from knowledge you gained in a former Bank assignment).Needless to say, I don't like that, especially after I was apprised of it, and discouraged from taking a particular USAID contract. (It's actually quite an interesting story, but too long for the moment, altho the guy who apprised me of it has not spoken to me since (does not return phone calls, or emails). So, "preferred vendors" have nothing to do with me. I myself am contracted as an individual independent contractor. Why couldn't I just ask them to make the contract with you, if they want me? (I can think of reasons, but I would want to know whether I should even broach this topic.) The contract for 35 days @ $900/day is in process.Approved provisionally, (but not finally) and, if fact, I have already been doing work on it, even though it is said to commence only on Oct 8th (but not yet signed by anybody). (My task team leader, who is responsible for me, is in Liberia, and will be back soon. So I will ask her, if I don't email her about the link before. (I imagine it might be a headache to change things at this point, but I like theidea.) Let me know if you have further insights. Thanks. Best,Alan On 10/5/12, Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>> wrote:> Hi Alan,> > Of course, it's my pleasure. The World Bank is a huge organization > that probably has a list of "preferred venders" that it may want you > to use (I highly doubt they would paid you directly), that being said, > MBO does have contracts with some very large firms and I know we could > meet The Bank's vender requirements.> > Show your contact at The Bank this> link<http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&enid=bWlkPW1ib0JldGFjdXN0LTAtMC0w> LTAtcHJvZC0wJm1zZ2lkPTAmZGlkPTEyMzQmc249MCZlaWQ9ZmFpcmJhbmthQGdtYWlsLm> vendor.> > I am looking forward to connecting with you on Tuesday.> > Thanks,> Sara> > ___________________________________> SARA CONDE> Consultant Services Advisor> MBO Partners> > t: 703.793.6028> f: I am a longtime consultant > to the World Bank, & am approved for a 35-day contract. Wondering if > the Bank would let me run payment thru MBO. Will be out of touch until > Tues. Any notion whether the Bank would entertain this idea. In past, > as consultant, I was considered a Bank staff member subject to all > those unfair restrictions. I suppose they would not want an > intermediary party. What is ur knowledge on this question?> Best> Alan> > Sent from my iPhone> > On Oct 5, 2012, at 12:54 PM, Sara Conde > <sconde@mbopartners.com<http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&enid=bWlkPW1ib> 0JldGFjdXN0LTAtMC0wLTAtcHJvZC0wJm1zZ2lkPTAmZGlkPTEyMzQmc249MCZlaWQ9ZmF> pcmJhbmthQGdtYWlsLmNvbSZ1aWQ9MCZleHRyYT1NVEU1ZkhOeVkybGtQVE0wTUh4dFlXb> HNhV1E5WkRJek1UVXpOakV0TURoaU5pMDBOMkZqTFRrelpEZ3RNalppTkdabU1UTmlNVGR> rTFRNME1IeG1jbTl0UFhOamIyNWtaVUJ0WW05d1lYSjBibVZ5Y3k1amIyMThjM1ZpYWoxU> 1JUb2dUbVYzSUUxQ1R5QlFiMmx1ZENCdlppQkRiMjUwWVdOMD0mJiY=&&&mailto:scond> e@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfVBQp0V35feYAq7gnjzMNJunttYXY52MuKVU <mailto:e@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCfVBQp0V35feYAq7gnjzMNJunttYXY52MuKVU>> syIUGIalUg%3D%3D>>> wrote:> Dear Alan ,> > I wanted to introduce myself as the person at MBO Partners responsible > for all new associate and partnership requests.
